belongs_to_collection.name: The Character of Physical Law - Messenger Lectures at Cornell University, 1964

original_title: Lecture 1: The Law of Gravitation - An Example of Physical Law
overview: After a brief introduction by Dale Carson, Dr. Richard Feynman discusses the physical law of gravity. He covers its origins through scientific discoveries in astronomy as well as Newton's contribution. He then discusses is implications and relation to other laws.
title: Lecture 1: The Law of Gravitation - An Example of Physical Law
